item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Percy wouldn't notice a joke if it danced naked in front of him wearing one of Dobby's hats." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by A.A. Milne
Elizabeth add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman
